verse.name: v1
verse.lines: A lusty young smith at his vice stood a'filing His hammer lay by but his forge still aglow When to him a buxom young damsel came smiling And asked him to work at her forge he would go

verse.name: c1
verse.lines: With a jingle bang jingle bang jingle bang jingle With a jingle bang jingle bang jingle hi-ho

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: I will said the smith, and they went off together Along to the young damsels forge they did go They stripped to go to it, 'twas hot work and hot weather She kindled a fire, and she soon made him glow

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: Her husband, she said, no good work could afford her His strength and his tool were worn out long ago The smith said, well mine are in very good order And now I am ready my skill for to show

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: Red hot grew his iron as both did desire But he was too wise not to strike while 'twas so Said she, What I get I get out of the fire, So with it strike home and redouble the blow

verse.name: v5
verse.lines: Six times did his iron through vigorous heating Grow soft in the forge in a minute or so And often would harden still beating and beating But the more it did soften did harden more slow

verse.name: v6
verse.lines: At last went the smith, 'towards the dame full of sorrow Oh what I would give could my husband do so Good lad with your hammer come hither tomorrow But pray could you use it once more 'ere you go?
